title: Leaver Buster is Unfair
body: Greetings. I'm here to whine about how Leaverbuster is unfair. Just kidding, though I believe it should be changed. I recently got out of my Low Priority Queue and went into a match. I was doing well at around 3-5 minutes until my League crashed. It took me about 6-7 minutes to even GET IN the game. Turns out my wifi is trashed on and I couldn't do anything since Comcast has terrible wifi. I was leaverbusted, AGAIN, even though I just got out of one. I thought Leaverbuster activated if you leave/dodge 5 games, not after when you just got out of one.

replies.body: If you are always getting afks or leaves then you'll keep getting low priority queues especially if you just came off one already and it doesn't happen after 5 leaves/dodges.  You should try to play with a hard connection instead of wifi if you can.

> [{quoted}](name=Lew,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=beuVARfg,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-09-05T00:15:21.721+0000)
>
> If you are always getting afks or leaves then you'll keep getting low priority queues especially if you just came off one already and it doesn't happen after 5 leaves/dodges.  You should try to play with a hard connection instead of wifi if you can.

Not sure what a "hard connection" is.

> [{quoted}](name=BcGoldenToaster,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=beuVARfg,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-09-05T01:54:13.161+0000)
>
> Not sure what a "hard connection" is.

That just means using a wired ethernet connection that goes into the router.

Regardless of whether or not your wifi was having issues at your house, leaving the game for any reason still puts your team at a disadvantage and only one left game *won't* get you punished. Since League is an online game, it's always best to make sure there aren't any [**network **](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)issues before queueing up for a match.

You shouldn't be punished for connection issues when Riot doesn't have a method for checking ping/ms BEFORE you try to get into a game. It's Labour Day weekend and I live in Brooklyn and the internet sucks because all the people are using it at once. I shouldn't be punished for something that is outside of my control AND when there is no way to tell before hand if I will have issues.
